Spiced Cranberry Sauce

Jump to Recipe

If you're looking to elevate your holiday feasts or simply want a deliciously tangy treat, this Spiced Cranberry Sauce recipe is just what you need. Bursting with vibrant flavors, this homemade sauce combines fresh cranberries with warm spices like cinnamon and cloves, balanced by the zesty brightness of orange. Whether it's for Thanksgiving, Christmas, or a special family dinner, this easy-to-make cranberry sauce is sure to impress your guests and become a staple on your table. With just a handful of ingredients, including sugar, water, and aromatic spices, you can create a delightful condiment that pairs perfectly with turkey, ham, or even as a spread on your morning toast. Plus, making your own cranberry sauce allows you to control the sweetness and spice levels to suit your taste. Join us as we guide you through this simple yet flavorful recipe that will enhance any meal and make every bite memorable!

Ingredients

fresh cranberries

Ensure the cranberries are bright and firm, avoiding any with blemishes or softness. If fresh cranberries aren't available, you can substitute with frozen cranberries; just add them directly to the pot without thawing. For a sweeter twist, consider mixing half cranberries with half raspberries.

sugar

Granulated sugar is standard, but you can substitute with brown sugar for a deeper flavor, honey for a natural sweetener, or maple syrup for a unique taste. Adjust the quantity based on your sweetness preference, as some cranberries can be tarter than others.

water

You can replace water with orange juice for an extra citrusy flavor, or use apple juice for a sweeter, fruity note. If you want a richer sauce, add a splash of red wine or a bit of brandy.

cinnamon stick

If you don’t have a cinnamon stick, you can use 1/2 teaspoon of ground cinnamon instead. For a spicier kick, consider adding a pinch of nutmeg or allspice. Remember to strain the sauce if using ground spices to avoid a gritty texture.

cloves

Whole cloves give a more subtle flavor compared to ground cloves, which can be used as a substitute (about 1/4 teaspoon). Be cautious with the amount, as ground cloves can be overpowering. You can also use star anise for a different aromatic profile.

orange zest

For a more intense orange flavor, you can use the juice of the orange in addition to the zest. If you don't have fresh oranges, use store-bought orange zest or even lemon zest for a different citrus note. Avoid using the white pith of the orange, as it can add bitterness.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Cranberries

    Rinse the fresh cranberries under cold water in a colander. Remove any stems or damaged berries to ensure the best flavor and texture.

  • Step 2: Make the Sugar Syrup

    In a medium saucepan, combine 1 cup of water and 1 cup of sugar. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring frequently until the sugar completely dissolves.

  • Step 3: Add Spices and Zest

    Once the sugar has dissolved, add the rinsed cranberries, 1 cinnamon stick, 4 whole cloves, and 1 tablespoon of orange zest to the saucepan. Stir to combine all ingredients.

  • Step 4: Simmer the Sauce

    Reduce the heat to medium-low and let the mixture simmer for about 10-15 minutes. Stir occasionally, allowing the cranberries to burst and the sauce to thicken to your desired consistency.

  • Step 5: Cool and Strain

    After simmering, remove the saucepan from the heat. Let the sauce cool for a few minutes. Carefully discard the cinnamon stick and cloves, as they are no longer needed.

  • Step 6: Serve or Store

    You can serve the spiced cranberry sauce warm, or let it cool completely and transfer it to an airtight container. Refrigerate for up to 2 weeks, or freeze for longer storage.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I properly prepare fresh cranberries for cooking?

Rinse the cranberries under cold water and remove any stems or damaged berries. This ensures that only the best fruit is used in your sauce.

What should I do if I don't have a cinnamon stick?

You can substitute ground cinnamon (about 1/2 teaspoon) for the cinnamon stick. Add it towards the end of cooking to prevent it from becoming too strong.

How can I tell when the cranberry sauce is done?

The sauce is done when the cranberries have burst and the mixture has thickened slightly. This usually takes about 10-15 minutes of simmering.

What if my sauce is too tart?

If the sauce is too tart for your taste, you can add more sugar, a tablespoon at a time, while cooking until you reach your desired sweetness.

Is it safe to eat raw cranberries?

Yes, but they are very tart and may not be pleasant to eat raw. Cooking them helps to bring out their natural sweetness.

How long can I store homemade cranberry sauce?

You can store homemade cranberry sauce in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to two weeks. It also freezes well for up to six months.

Can I add other spices or flavors to my cranberry sauce?

Absolutely! You can experiment with spices like nutmeg or add ingredients like chopped apples or nuts for added texture and flavor.

What should I do with leftover cranberry sauce?

Leftover cranberry sauce can be used in various ways: spread it on toast, mix it into yogurt, or use it as a glaze for meats.

How do I safely discard the spices after cooking?

Simply remove the cinnamon stick and cloves with a slotted spoon or fork before serving to ensure your sauce has a smooth texture.

Can I make cranberry sauce in advance?

Yes! Cranberry sauce can be made a few days ahead of your meal. Just make sure to store it in the fridge and reheat it gently before serving.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This spiced cranberry sauce is naturally gluten-free and vegan, making it suitable for a variety of dietary preferences. For a lower sugar option, consider using a sugar substitute like agave syrup or a stevia blend that measures like sugar. Additionally, ensure that the spices used (like cloves and cinnamon) are fresh and free from additives for optimal flavor.

Pairings

For a festive holiday table, serve the spiced cranberry sauce alongside roasted turkey or ham to enhance the savory flavors of the meat. It also pairs beautifully with a variety of cheeses, particularly sharp cheddar or creamy brie. For beverages, consider a crisp white wine like Sauvignon Blanc or a fruity red like Pinot Noir, which can complement the tartness of the cranberries.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the spiced cranberry sauce in a decorative bowl, garnished with a sprig of fresh rosemary or mint for a pop of color. For a more sophisticated touch, drizzle a little balsamic glaze over the sauce just before serving. If using it as a condiment, provide small spoons for easy serving at a buffet or family-style meal. It can also be served warm or at room temperature, depending on preference.

#

Spiced Cranberry Sauce

30 min
$3.5
80 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 8

Dietary Tags:

VeganGluten-Free

Cuisine:

American

Course:

CondimentSide Dish

Tags:

EasyQuickHolidayCondiment

Description

A zesty and aromatic cranberry sauce perfect for any holiday table, infused with warm spices.

Ingredients

  • fresh cranberries: 12 oz
  • sugar: 1 cup
  • water: 1 cup
  • cinnamon stick: 1
  • cloves: 4
  • orange zest: 1 tbsp
